conclusion: We need to determine the refractive index of the transparent material for both red and green light.
The figure shows a semicircle brick with a radius of R, made of a special transparent material, with diameter MN and center point O.
A beam of laser mixed with red and green light is injected perpendicular to the edge of the brick diameter MN at the center point O of R/2.

When the laser beam slowly shifts to the left from the point O, it is found that only monochromatic light is emitted from the semicircle surface, and the angle between the emitted light and the incident direction is 30 degrees, regardless of reflection.
The refractive index for red light is determined by analyzing the behavior of the laser beam when it shifts to the left from the center point O and emits monochromatic light at a 30-degree angle.
The refractive index for red light is 1.
The refractive index for green light is determined by analyzing the behavior of the laser beam when it shifts to the left from the center point O and emits monochromatic light at a 30-degree angle.
The refractive index for green light is 1.
The refractive index of the transparent material for both red and green light is 1.
